answers.answer: Hi!Yes, you should be concerned. If your son want to build a body (like most boys his age like to do), then he must do so under a trained physical trainer. The right diet with a combination of aerobic, strength training and stretch exercises are required to help build the body in right proportion. Hence please ask him to join a gym with the right credentials.Take care!

question: My teen age son (16.5 years old, 62 21% body fat) increased his weight so he could develop muscles by weight lifting. Now he wants to go on a keto diet to better define his muscles.  I have type one diabetes and understand the effects of the body breaking down protein for fuel, and losing ketones through urine. I am worried about the effect on him. Should I be concerned? .
title: Teen Health Nutrition Weighlifting Diet
